title: How to Configure Automations in Hiver
content:
Automations in Hiver help you streamline repetitive tasks and ensure consistent workflows. Here's how to configure them:

1. Navigate to Settings: Click on the gear icon in the top right corner and select 'Automations' from the menu.

2. Create a New Automation: Click the 'Create Automation' button. You'll see options for different trigger types:
   - Email received
   - Email assigned
   - Status changed
   - Tag added/removed

3. Set Trigger Conditions: Choose when the automation should run. For example, 'When an email is received from a specific domain' or 'When a tag is added'.

4. Define Actions: Select what should happen when the trigger conditions are met:
   - Auto-assign to a team member
   - Add tags automatically
   - Send auto-replies
   - Change email status
   - Add notes

5. Add Filters (Optional): Narrow down when the automation runs using filters like:
   - Sender email address
   - Subject contains specific keywords
   - Email body contains certain text
   - Time of day

6. Test Your Automation: Before activating, use the 'Test' feature to ensure it works as expected.

7. Activate: Toggle the automation to 'Active' status.

Best Practices:
- Start with simple automations and gradually add complexity
- Use clear naming conventions for easy management
- Regularly review and update automations
- Avoid creating conflicting automations
- Monitor automation logs to track performance

Common Use Cases:
- Auto-assign emails from VIP customers to senior support agents
- Automatically tag emails based on keywords in the subject
- Send acknowledgment emails for specific inquiry types
- Escalate unresponded emails after a certain time period
